q: so aggressive at fundraising that some fellow Dartmouth graduates have reportedly been irked by her appropriation of the alumni mailing list to solicit donations. But Kirsten Gillibrand evinces neither shame nor annoyance at having to work the cash circuit. Raising money is the very same effort as developing a grassroots advocacy, she asserts. She is also Zen about the rough-and-tumble nature of her profession-an attitude she credits to her grandmother. The attacks Polly Noonan encountered as head of the Albany Democratic machine engendered a defiant streak in Kirsten Gillibrand
